meanings.definition: A pouch or flap attached to the front of the crotch of men's tight-fitting breeches, popular in the 15th and 16th centuries.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, knights wore a codpiece to protect their private parts.
meanings.sent2: The codpiece was a fashionable accessory in the 15th century.
meanings.sent3: The jester's codpiece was so big, it looked like a tiny tent!
meanings.sent4: His confidence was his codpiece, always on display for the world to see.
meanings.sent5: The shiny codpiece gleamed under the castle's torchlight.

meanings.definition: A decorative covering for the crotch in men's tights or hose, worn in the 15th and 16th centuries.
meanings.sent1: Noblemen often adorned their outfits with a fancy codpiece.
meanings.sent2: The tailor embroidered a golden thread design on the codpiece.
meanings.sent3: The codpiece was the envy of all the court jesters.
meanings.sent4: His codpiece was a symbol of his status among the nobility.
meanings.sent5: The intricate patterns on the codpiece mesmerized the onlookers.
